selected_quotes: Does Evidence Support American Heart Assoc's Recommendation to Screen Patients for Depression? Nope
Does Evidence Support Am Heart Assoc's Recommendation to Screen Patients for Depression in Cardiovascular Care? NO!
Updated Review of Evidence for American Heart Assoc Recommendation to Screen Patients for Depression in Cardio Care.
.@PLOSONE Evidence versus AHA Guidelines for Screening for Depression. Evidence loses out.

citation.abstract: To systematically review evidence on depression screening in coronary heart disease (CHD) by assessing the (1) accuracy of screening tools; (2) effectiveness of treatment; and (3) effect of screening on depression outcomes.
citation.title: Does Evidence Support the American Heart Association's Recommendation to Screen Patients for Depression in Cardiovascular Care? An Updated Systematic Review

news.title: Depression in heart attack survivors is common
news.summary: Clyde Boyce has been hospitalized 14 times in the past four years. Boyce, 61, survived two strokes and five operations to unblock arteries around his heart, including three procedures in which doctors propped open his blood vessels with stents.
